intro: Strophocaulon unitum, commonly known as the slender false nettle, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. It produces small, yellowish-white flowers that are clustered in racemes, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Strophocaulon unitum is often found in moist, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and stream banks.
